summary: Fair lending laws prohibit lenders from discriminating on the basis of race and other characteristics. The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency oversees national banks' compliance with these laws. We found that the Office: Used outdated examination guidance, and examiners followed procedures inconsistently in some examinations Made major process changes in 2018 that contributed to fewer examinations of smaller banks, with further changes intended...
title: Fair Lending: Opportunities Exist to Enhance OCC's Oversight of Banks' Lending Practices
